meanings.definition: Having a disheveled or unkempt appearance.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the children looked blowzier than usual.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was blowzier than usual after getting caught in the rain.
meanings.sent3: Even though he tried to look neat, his clothes always ended up looking blowzier by the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house had a blowzier appearance with its overgrown garden and broken windows.
meanings.sent5: The messy room only became blowzier as more toys were scattered around.

meanings.definition: A person who is untidy or slovenly in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She was known in the neighborhood as the blowzier due to her constantly unkempt hair.
meanings.sent2: The blowzier at the party stood out with their wrinkled clothes and mismatched socks.
meanings.sent3: The blowzier always managed to find the most comfortable spot on the couch, surrounded by clutter.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of neatly dressed individuals, the blowzier was easy to spot.
meanings.sent5: The blowzier's appearance contrasted sharply with the other guests at the event.
